title: Neglected Americans vs. Pampered Illegals: FEMA’s Failures Ignite Outrage from Ben Bergquam
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: While hurricane-ravaged Appalachia is left out in the cold illegal migrants live comfortably in taxpayer-funded hotels, sparking fury over government...
content:
While hurricane-ravaged Appalachia is left out in the cold illegal migrants live comfortably in taxpayer-funded hotels, sparking fury over government priorities.

Steve Bannon and Ben Bergquam called out the former Biden administration on Friday’s WarRoom for its stark neglect of disaster-stricken Americans in Appalachian communities while lavishing care on illegal immigrants. Their remarks paint a damning picture of government incompetence and misplaced priorities.

Watch a quick clip of the discussion:

Four Months, Little Progress

In Western North Carolina, Tennessee, and Georgia, many hurricane victims are still living in tents through a brutal winter. FEMA’s response? Almost nonexistent. Bergquam noted that FEMA representatives are scarce, and their assistance—when it happens—moves at a snail’s pace. "Four months in, and they’ve set up only five trailers,” one local commissioner shared.

Instead of quick relief, the community has relied on grassroots efforts. Bergquam highlighted local organizations and churches stepping up where FEMA has failed. "This has all been donation-driven,” he said.

"Rebuilding Ukraine Faster Than Appalachia”

The most searing critique came from Bergquam, who compared the administration’s priorities: "They’re rebuilding Ukraine faster than they’re rebuilding parts of Appalachia.” His remarks underscored the glaring disparity between international aid and domestic disaster relief.

Bannon chimed in, asking why FEMA’s usual presence was missing. "In California, FEMA is wall-to-wall. Where are they here? No jackets, no vehicles, no boots on the ground,” he pressed. The locals answered plainly: FEMA has abandoned them.

Hotel Rooms for Illegals, Tents for Americans

The contrast is jarring. Bergquam reported live from a newly renovated Chicago hotel packed with illegal immigrants. These individuals enjoy warm rooms, three meals a day, cash cards, and other benefits—all courtesy of American taxpayers.

Meanwhile, disaster victims in Appalachia struggle to survive in freezing temperatures. "It’s animal-like conditions,” Bannon exclaimed. Bergquam noted the irony: "Joe Biden and the Democrats abandoned these people but rolled out the red carpet for an organized invasion of illegals.”

A Political Turning Point?

Bergquam credited President Trump’s decision to visit these devastated areas as a sign of leadership. "President Trump puts America First,” he said. Trump’s visit and his team’s efforts aim to spotlight these forgotten communities.

The Biden administration, however, continues to face criticism for prioritizing border crises over its constitutional duty to protect American citizens. As Bergquam put it, "The government’s primary job is to protect its citizens—not to aid an invasion.”

The sharp divide between the treatment of hurricane victims and illegal immigrants highlights deep flaws in the administration’s priorities. While citizens suffer in tents, migrants enjoy taxpayer-funded luxury. The question remains: When will American leaders prioritize their own people?

For more context, watch this full clip of the conversation from Friday’s WarRoom:

Steve Bannon And Ben Bergquam Compare The Treatment Of Illegals To NC Disaster Victims

title: Uncovering the Pipe Bomb Hoax: Beattie’s Bombshell and What It Means for Kash Patel’s FBI Nomination
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Revolutions in Reporting: Beattie’s Investigations and the Need for Kash Patel’s Leadership at the FBI Darren Beattie’s investigative work at...
content:
Revolutions in Reporting: Beattie’s Investigations and the Need for Kash Patel’s Leadership at the FBI

Darren Beattie’s investigative work at Revolver News has illuminated one of the most controversial aspects of the January 6 Capitol riot: the pipe bomb incident. His relentless investigation has uncovered what he believes to be a series of deliberate and suspicious actions by federal agencies, raising questions about the integrity of the government’s narrative.

Beattie appeared on Thursday’s WarRoom to give an update to his work:

On the WarRoom with Steve Bannon, Beattie argues that the government’s handling of the January 6 events, particularly the pipe bombs, was not just flawed—it was a coordinated effort to mislead the public. This perspective has placed Beattie at the center of a growing movement of skeptical Americans who are beginning to question the official story. His reporting on the pipe bomb investigation has been groundbreaking, and it has made him a key figure in the effort to uncover what happened that day.

A Timeline of Inconsistent Investigations: The Pipe Bomb Cover-Up

Beattie’s deep dive into the pipe bomb investigation for Revolver News paints a picture of an investigation that was shut down prematurely. According to his research, the FBI initially conducted a thorough investigation into the bombs that were discovered near the Capitol on January 6, 2021. However, something went wrong around May of 2021, when the investigation mysteriously went dark. Beattie describes this as a significant turning point—one that raised alarm bells for him and other investigators. The FBI, after initially chasing leads and reviewing surveillance footage, essentially abandoned the case. Beattie’s reporting suggests that the FBI, at least in the early months after January 6, was on the trail of key evidence but was either obstructed or ordered to halt its efforts.

The fact that the investigation died down so early is especially troubling for Beattie. Not only does it imply that critical leads were ignored, but it also casts doubt on the entire narrative surrounding the pipe bombs. To Beattie, the lack of progress in the investigation signals that the FBI may have been involved in a deliberate cover-up. He even claims that other agencies, like the ATF and Secret Service, were complicit in suppressing evidence. This raises questions about the involvement of higher government officials, something that Beattie argues could have been orchestrated at the very top of the administration.

Trump’s Role in the Investigation

Beattie’s work has also drawn the attention of President Donald Trump, who has repeatedly commented on the issues surrounding January 6. Trump’s statements have supported much of Beattie’s findings, particularly his assertion that the FBI already knows who planted the bombs. Trump has gone further to suggest that the real story behind the pipe bombs is far more damning than anyone in government wants to admit. Beattie believes that Trump’s involvement is crucial, as his statements validate the research and point to the more significant issue of government cover-ups.

The public nature of Trump’s comments has helped amplify the concerns raised by Beattie and others in the investigative community. Trump has long been a critic of the FBI and the broader intelligence community, and his vocal support for Beattie’s findings has only intensified scrutiny of the investigation. Beattie notes that Trump’s focus on the pipe bombs signals that the former president is aware of the more profound implications of this issue. By speaking out, Trump is acknowledging that what happened on January 6 was not a spontaneous insurrection but rather a planned operation involving multiple government agencies.

The Call for Kash Patel’s Leadership

For Beattie, the solution to this investigation’s deadlock lies in the leadership of Kash Patel, a former aide to President Trump and a staunch critic of the FBI’s handling of several high-profile cases. Patel has become a symbol of hope for many who want to see justice in the investigation of January 6. Beattie is hopeful that if Patel is confirmed as the next FBI director, the final pieces of the puzzle will be put together. Patel has the experience and integrity needed to oversee a thorough investigation into the events of that day.

Beattie believes that Patel’s leadership would signal a turning point in the FBI’s case handling. According to Beattie, Patel’s appointment would be crucial in uncovering the truth behind the pipe bombs and the broader January 6 narrative. He argues that the FBI’s previous inaction and possible involvement in a cover-up can only be addressed under Patel’s direction. Beattie also notes that Patel’s history of standing up to the establishment makes him the ideal person to challenge the deep state’s influence over key investigations.

The Broader Implications: A Systemic Problem

Beattie’s investigation into the pipe bombs is not just about exposing a cover-up—it’s about understanding the broader implications for American democracy. Beattie argues that the pipe bomb incident is just one piece of a much larger puzzle involving corruption and manipulation at the highest levels of government. The investigation can potentially expose systemic problems within the FBI, the ATF, and even the Secret Service, which have all played roles in maintaining a false narrative about January 6.

Beattie’s work ties the pipe bomb incident directly to the narrative surrounding the Capitol riot. He insists that the pipe bombs were planted as part of a coordinated effort to escalate the situation and justify the government’s response. For Beattie, the ultimate goal is not just to uncover the truth but to hold those responsible accountable.

For more context, watch the whole Thursday WarRoom segment featuring Darren Beattie:

Darren Beattie Lays Out Case Of J6 Pipe Bomb: The FBI Stopped Their Investigation Because What They Found Was Incriminating To The Biden Regime

title: South Korea’s Political Crisis Deepens Amid Chinese Influence and U.S. Military Concerns
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: There is a rapidly escalating situation, South Korea is witnessing a political crisis that could have far-reaching implications for the...
content:
There is a rapidly escalating situation, South Korea is witnessing a political crisis that could have far-reaching implications for the region, as protests and political unrest intensify.

In a Saturday WarRoom conversation between Steve Bannon and retired Colonel John Mills, the two highlighted the dangerous convergence of internal political turmoil and external Chinese interference that threatens the stability of one of the U.S.’s most trusted allies in East Asia.

President Yoon Suk-yeol is facing a political and social storm as thousands take to the streets in opposition to his government. Demonstrators have called for an end to martial law, but a significant portion of the protesters, according to Bannon and Mills, are reportedly Chinese nationals who have been flown in to incite further unrest. “One-third to two-thirds of these protests are Chinese,” Mills claimed, raising alarms about China’s growing influence in South Korea’s internal affairs.

The political landscape in South Korea has become increasingly divided. The left-wing Democratic Party, led by Lee Jae-myung, has mounted a significant challenge to President Yoon’s leadership, accusing him of authoritarianism. Lee, who was recently convicted of malfeasance, has been a vocal critic of U.S. military presence in South Korea, calling American forces an "occupation force” and pushing for the removal of THAAD missile systems. His anti-U.S. stance aligns with China’s broader geopolitical goals, as Beijing seeks to expand its regional influence.

In response to mounting political pressure, President Yoon declared martial law on December 3rd, 2023, a highly controversial move. However, as Bannon and Mills pointed out, Yoon’s decision was strategic. The martial law declaration allowed him to launch a raid on the National Election Commission, which, according to Yoon’s government, was necessary to investigate suspected Chinese interference in South Korea’s elections. While legally justified, this move has sparked widespread outrage and fear of authoritarianism, fueling the protests.

South Korea’s political system is becoming increasingly polarized as the situation unfolds. Yoon’s government has been at odds with the Democratic Party, which controls the National Assembly. The conservative People Power Party, in support of Yoon, is facing fierce opposition from the left. Mills, a former U.S. military officer with deep knowledge of East Asian geopolitics, warned that South Korea is in the midst of a power struggle that could weaken its defense posture against China. "This is a critical moment for South Korea,” Mills said. "If this government falls, the entire U.S.-South Korea alliance could be destabilized.”

The political crisis in South Korea is not only a domestic issue but also a matter of strategic importance for the United States. The U.S. military has had a presence in South Korea since the Korean War, with approximately 28,000 troops stationed in the country. South Korea plays a pivotal role in the U.S.’s strategy to counter China’s growing influence in the region. If the protests and political unrest result in the downfall of President Yoon, it could create a vacuum that China may seek to exploit to undermine the U.S.-South Korea alliance.

Adding to the complexity of the situation is the broader regional context. As Mills noted, South Korea is also attempting to rebuild its strained relationship with Japan, a key partner in the U.S.-led effort to counter China. However, the political left in South Korea, led by figures like Lee Jae-myung, is fiercely anti-Japan, further complicating the situation. With tensions between China, Japan, and South Korea already high, the potential collapse of Yoon’s government could leave South Korea vulnerable to Chinese influence.

Bannon and Mills also expressed concern over the influence of the media in shaping public perception of the crisis. The mainstream media in South Korea, they argued, is largely sympathetic to the left-wing narrative, which portrays the situation as a struggle against authoritarianism. This portrayal, according to Bannon and Mills, obscures the deeper geopolitical battle playing out behind the scenes, where China is actively working to weaken South Korea’s government and undermine its alliance with the United States.

The situation in South Korea is rapidly evolving, and with it, the stakes for U.S. interests in East Asia. As the political crisis deepens, the U.S. and its allies must closely monitor the developments in South Korea and prepare for potential fallout that could reshape the region’s security dynamics. For now, the people of South Korea remain at the center of a high-stakes geopolitical struggle, one that could have profound consequences for the future of East Asian stability.

For more context, watch this Saturday segment:

Col. John Mills: "This Is A Chinese Malign Influence That Could Topple South Korea”

title: Battleground Report: Trump Whips for Speaker Johnson—The WarRoom’s Marching Orders for America’s Future
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Trump’s Support for Speaker Johnson: A Strategic Move Steve Bannon’s comments on Friday morning WarRoom highlighted a pivotal moment in...
content:
Trump’s Support for Speaker Johnson: A Strategic Move

Steve Bannon’s comments on Friday morning WarRoom highlighted a pivotal moment in the political landscape with the incoming 119th Congress being seated: President Trump’s support for Speaker Mike Johnson. According to Bannon, this is no casual endorsement—it’s a calculated move that signals Trump’s commitment to reshaping America’s legislative priorities. For the WarRoom audience, understanding this alignment is critical to grasping the broader battle ahead.

Trump’s involvement goes beyond symbolic support. Bannon suggests Trump might actively whip votes to back Speaker Johnson. Why? Because the stakes are too high. From budget battles to defending conservative principles, Johnson’s leadership represents a frontline defense against what many see as a post-constitutional crisis in the United States.

Watch Friday’s opening segment of WarRoom for more context:

Steve Bannon Previews Speaker Race: "What Is The Task And The Purpose Of The House”

Johnson’s 1,500-Page Bill Bombshell: A Wake-Up Call

Speaker Johnson recently dropped a 1,500-page bill packed with hundreds of billions in spending. For the WarRoom faithful, this raises red flags. Bannon didn’t mince words about the challenges Johnson faces. He criticized the lack of spending offsets and the reliance on continuing resolutions (CRs) to fund the government—a tactic long despised by grassroots conservatives.

Trump’s potential involvement in whipping support for Johnson suggests this isn’t just about one bill. It’s about setting the stage for a larger agenda. The WarRoom audience is urged to stay vigilant. They must question whether these moves truly serve America’s interests or fall into the same traps that have frustrated patriots for decades.

The Task and Purpose: Why This Matters

Bannon stressed a key question: What is the task and purpose of the House under Johnson’s leadership? For Trump supporters, this boils down to more than just legislation—it’s about saving a nation they believe is “radically off track.”

Johnson’s role is pivotal. As Bannon pointed out, the Trump movement can’t afford unforced errors. Every decision, every vote, must align with the larger mission: restoring sovereignty to American citizens and upholding the constitutional republic. Trump’s hands-on approach signals that he sees Johnson as a critical ally in this effort.

WarRoom’s Call to Action: Use Your Agency

Bannon’s rallying cry to the WarRoom audience is clear: Get involved. He reminded listeners that grassroots activism has historically delivered stunning victories, such as Dave Brat’s unexpected primary win over Eric Cantor. That victory, fueled by a dedicated base, serves as a blueprint for what can be achieved with focused effort.

For WarRoom followers, this means using their agency. Whether it’s reading up on legislation, making calls, or organizing locally, every action counts. The grassroots energy that propelled Trump in 2016 must now be channeled to understand the dynamics of the House and the broader conservative agenda.

Trump and Johnson: A Partnership to Watch

The partnership between Trump and Johnson represents a critical junction in America’s political battle. For WarRoom listeners, it’s a reminder of the importance of staying engaged and holding leaders accountable. Bannon’s message was clear: The fight is far from over, and every member of the movement has a role to play.

The next few months will test the strength and resolve of the MAGA movement. Will Trump’s support for Johnson pave the way for meaningful change, or will it fall victim to the same pitfalls that have plagued Congress for years? For now, all eyes are on the Speaker—and the WarRoom is watching closely.

This battleground report underscores the urgency of the moment. As Bannon said, the WarRoom audience must stay ready. The stakes couldn’t be higher.

Watch the full Friday morning WarRoom for more:

title: The Power of the Posse:
author: JOJO
excerpt: Every year, I eagerly anticipate December, not just for the holiday season, but for the tremendous gathering that is America...
content:
Every year, I eagerly anticipate December, not just for the holiday season, but for the tremendous gathering that is America Fest (AmFest) in Arizona. As the Grassroots Liaison to the WarRoom team, this event is a highlight of my year—a chance to connect with like-minded patriots and refocus on the mission we all share.

From the moment I step into the convention center, there’s a distinct energy in the air. Media row, with its dynamic displays and steady activity, is the heartbeat of the event. At the center of it all is the Real America’s Voice studio booth, a hub of activity that consistently draws a crowd. Watching WarRoom broadcast live from this setup is nothing short of inspiring.

Steve Bannon, always in his element, commands the space with precision and purpose. He bridges the gap between delivering critical information and motivating the Posse with a directness that’s unparalleled. The platform he’s built is far more than a news outlet; it’s a rallying point for patriots everywhere. Each live broadcast at AmFest reinforces how vital this connection is to the grassroots movement.

No AmFest would be complete without Steve’s speeches. The convention center comes alive when he takes the stage, with no seat left empty. Every speech builds on the last, leaving the crowd more energized and focused. The thunderous applause and cheers are a reminder of the collective strength and determination of the Posse.

Beyond the speeches and broadcasts, AmFest offers something equally valuable: the opportunity to connect. Meeting fellow Posse members—some for the first time, others from past events or online forums—is always a highlight. These moments of shared stories and experiences create bonds that strengthen our movement and our resolve.

What stands out most every year are the stories. Some attendees seek direction on turning their passion into action, while others proudly share how their advocacy groups are making real changes in their communities. These exchanges remind me that every role, big or small, contributes to the greater mission. Together, we are essential links in a chain, driving the movement forward.

Each year, AmFest renews my sense of purpose and commitment. The chance to meet up with the Posse at conventions like this energizes me to strengthen and grow in my role. It motivates me to find new ways to help the Posse target their strengths in areas where they can make the greatest impact. I’m already looking forward to next year’s AmFest, knowing it will once again bring us together, inspire action, and strengthen our resolve to continue moving forward victoriously.

*** Next Man Up ***

Special Thanks to Noah & Jessy for Photo Contributions.

title: America First: Defining Citizenship and Prioritizing the American People in 2024
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: After-Action Report:  Understanding the True Meaning of "America First" in the Wake of President Trump's Resounding Victory The victory of...
content:
After-Action Report:  Understanding the True Meaning of “America First” in the Wake of President Trump’s Resounding Victory

The victory of President Donald J. Trump in 2024 marked a historic turning point in the nation’s political landscape. The America First agenda, which has defined Trump’s approach since his first campaign in 2016, continues to resonate powerfully with millions of Americans. This movement is grounded in the principle that the American people should come before all others, ensuring that the needs and rights of U.S. citizens are prioritized in every area of government policy.

In a Friday conversation on WarRoom between Steve Bannon and Jack Posobiec, a critical distinction was made that clarifies and reinforces the foundation of the America First movement. Bannon and Posobiec explained that while the idea of “America First” has been misinterpreted or manipulated by various political forces, its core meaning is simple and non-negotiable: American citizens are the priority. This is not a question of race, background, or heritage. It is a matter of legal and sworn citizenship.

Distinction Between Citizenship and Ethnic Background

Bannon and Posobiec underscored that what matters in the context of America First is not the individual’s ethnic background but their sworn allegiance as a citizen of the United States. This principle emphasizes that every person who is an American citizen, regardless of their origin, deserves to be treated with respect, fairness, and priority. The values and priorities of the America First movement are centered on ensuring that Americans, particularly those who have fought for the nation or contributed to its growth, are not displaced by foreign interests or cheap labor from overseas.

Posobiec pointed out that the real fight of the America First agenda is to ensure that those who have “bones in the ground”—the people who have built and defended the country—are the ones who are given the opportunities and resources they deserve. In stark contrast, the globalist elites, including both CEOs and Marxists, often push for policies that serve only their own interests, like importing cheap labor or prioritizing global concerns over domestic prosperity.

The Need for Clarity on America First

The importance of understanding the true meaning of America First is crucial for the ongoing success of the movement. As Bannon stated, this is not about abstract numbers or spreadsheets. It is about the American people—the working class, the veterans, the everyday citizens who have carried the weight of this nation for generations. The 2024 election results have shown that this message resonates more than ever, as voters continue to reject globalist policies and embrace a vision of national pride, sovereignty, and respect for the American citizen.

One of the key areas where this distinction plays out is in the immigration debate. The America First agenda does not advocate for shutting the door to those seeking a better life but does insist that America’s needs come first. Ensuring that U.S. citizens are provided with jobs, healthcare, and opportunities should always be the priority. Bannon and Posobiec made it clear that while America is a welcoming nation, the rights of American citizens cannot be compromised by the importation of cheap foreign labor. Policies that treat American workers as secondary are detrimental to the nation’s long-term prosperity.

Conclusion: The Path Forward

The conversation between Bannon and Posobiec serves as a reminder that the America First movement is fundamentally about the people. The real power of the movement lies in ensuring that the American citizen, regardless of background, is prioritized in every aspect of national policy. President Trump’s victory in 2024 has reaffirmed this vision, signaling a continued commitment to putting America and its people first.

Moving forward, all Americans must understand and embrace the true meaning of America First: a nation that puts its citizens—those who have earned their place as members of the republic—at the forefront of policy and governance.

For more context watch:

Jack Posobiec And Steve Bannon: It Is American CITIZENS First

title: Nation on the Brink, but WarRoom and Trump Are Charging Into 2025 Ready for Battle
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: SIT-REP: The Golden Age of Trump, Steve Bannon Unleashes His Vision for America's Future The Arc of History and the...
content:
SIT-REP: The Golden Age of Trump, Steve Bannon Unleashes His Vision for America’s Future

The Arc of History and the Golden Age of Trump

On December 23, 2024, Steve Bannon kicked off his War Room broadcast with a powerful message about the "Golden Age of Trump,” framing it as a pivotal moment in American history. "This is the age of Trump,” Bannon said, emphasizing the shift in national politics and the movement’s trajectory. His speech, marked by high energy, reflected the intense devotion of his "WarRoom Posse” — a group of supporters following his lead through this fight for the country’s future.

Bannon passionately spoke about the significance of this moment, highlighting how Trump’s vision is transforming America. The Golden Age is more than just a political comeback; it completely reshapes the country’s course. “We’re not just fighting for the next election; we’re fighting for the future of this nation,” he declared, emphasizing the personal stakes involved in this revolution.

President Trump praised the WarRoom in his historic Sunday speech:

The 21 Million Deportations: A Game-Changer

A major point in Bannon’s commentary was Trump’s bold deportation claim. In his Sunday speech, Trump reportedly used the figure "21 million” to describe the number of deportations he plans, starkly contrasting the typical estimates of around 12 to 15 million. "I’ve reached out to the Trump team to double-check that number, and I think it’s monumental,” Bannon said. Regardless of the precise number, the message was clear: under a second Trump administration, the deportation effort would be on a scale never seen before. This number alone highlights Trump’s unyielding stance on border control and his commitment to reshaping America’s immigration policy.

Full Speech: 

What Motivates Trump? And What Fuels Bannon?

Bannon went on to reflect on what motivates both him and President Trump. For Bannon, it’s about ensuring that America doesn’t fall victim to the "established order” that he believes has betrayed the country. “This fight isn’t just about Donald Trump; it’s about saving the country from a political class that doesn’t represent the people,” he said.

For Trump, the motivation is even more personal. "He has won 2020 in his soul,” Bannon revealed. This belief in a stolen election drives Trump’s unrelenting fight to reclaim power, and it’s a key reason why he’s so committed to the next phase of this political war. "This is the linkage,” Bannon emphasized, clarifying that Trump’s belief in 2020’s illegitimacy is at the heart of his push for the Golden Age.

The Sunlit Uplands: Beyond the Deportations

Bannon also touched on the broader vision for America, referring to it as the "Sunlit Uplands” — a time of prosperity and strength once the country fights its current chaos. He framed the deportations, wars, and political battles as part of a necessary process to get America back on track. "We’re fighting against the radical left, the donor class, and political puppets,” Bannon said, underscoring the magnitude of the battle ahead.

A Movement Fueled by the People

Bannon wrapped up his remarks by reflecting on the incredible energy he’s witnessed firsthand from his supporters. He spoke about the thousands of people he met during recent events like AMPFest, where the energy was palpable. “The intensity is incredible,” he said, emphasizing how important it is for the War Room’s audience to stay focused and involved. Bannon sees his followers as crucial to the movement’s success, and he’s clearly invested in their engagement. "You are the Vanguard, the Cadre — the tip of the spear,” he told them, calling on them to keep pushing forward.

Conclusion: A Fight That’s Just Beginning

Bannon’s message on this December Monday was clear: the fight for America’s future is far from over. The Golden Age of Trump is just beginning; with it, the movement’s most complex challenges lie ahead. As Bannon said, "We’re not backing down. We owe it to this country.” The stakes are high, and Trump and his followers are ready to continue the battle for the nation’s future.

For more context, watch the opening segment of Monday’s WarRoom:

"The Representation Of The Posse Was Incredible.” Steve Bannon Reflects On AmFest 2024

title: White Flag Surrender: Christopher Wray Leaves, ‘Hands Up”, Resigns From Mounting Pressure
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Situation Report, Christopher Wray Resigns: In a blistering Thursday commentary on the WarRoom, Steve Bannon reacted to footage aired on...
content:
Situation Report, Christopher Wray Resigns:

In a blistering Thursday commentary on the WarRoom, Steve Bannon reacted to footage aired on MSNBC discussing Christopher Wray’s resignation as FBI Director. The cold open included claims of internal FBI dissatisfaction, allegations of resistance within the agency, and Wray’s failure to stand firm amidst political and institutional turmoil. Bannon wasted no time dissecting Wray’s decision to step down, using charged language to underscore what he viewed as a cowardly capitulation.

Resources for this report: 

Crossfire Hurricane Reckoning: Mike Davis and Steve Bannon Demand Justice for Trump’s Second Term

Bannon’s Solemn Pledge to Heaven Comes True: GOP Exposes Pelosi’s January 6th Failures Even as He Sits Behind Bars

Thursday’s Cold Open

The MSNBC segment painted a picture of a fractured FBI. The host suggested that some within the agency, including former FBI special agents, were unhappy with its direction. They reportedly supported major reforms and had ties to figures like Kash Patel and groups seeking to “bust up” the bureau. Wray, the segment implied, could have stayed to provide stability but chose to leave, thereby handing the reins to Trump’s incoming administration. The anchor lamented this decision, framing Wray’s resignation as a missed opportunity to safeguard continuity within the FBI.

The segment ended with speculation about Trump’s intentions to reshape the FBI, possibly through figures like Patel, who critics fear could turn the bureau into a “department of revenge and retribution.”

Bannon’s Take

Bannon began his response by casting Wray’s resignation as an act of surrender. "He didn’t just leave,” Bannon said. "He waved the white flag. Hands up, no fight, no resistance. Total capitulation.” To Bannon, this act symbolized a broader failure within the establishment to stand up against the forces of reform and accountability represented by Trump and his allies.

Bannon contrasted Wray’s resignation with what he sees as the unyielding fearlessness of Trump’s inner circle. "President Trump, he never shows fear. Kash Patel, Peter Navarro, Boris Epshteyn—these are fighters. They’ve been through it all, from diesel therapy to public smears, and they’re still standing. That’s how you win. You don’t back down. You don’t quit.”

A Failure to Hold the Line

Bannon lambasted Wray for not staying to “stand in the breach.” According to him, Wray had a unique opportunity to act as a buffer against chaos but instead chose personal preservation. "If Wray had any backbone, he would have stayed another six months. Just long enough to hold the line while the new administration sorted itself out. Instead, he chose to walk away, leaving the FBI leaderless and vulnerable.”

Bannon argued that Wray’s departure not only weakened the FBI but also emboldened Trump’s movement. "They needed him to stay,” he said, referring to establishment figures who hoped Wray could mitigate the impact of incoming reforms. "Without him, it’s game over. They’re scrambling now, panicked. And guess what? Trump is coming, and he’s bringing the reckoning with him.”

The Bigger Picture

Bannon’s commentary framed Wray’s resignation as part of a larger narrative about the collapse of establishment resistance to Trump’s agenda. He linked the resignation to broader themes of war, debt, and immigration, painting a dire picture of converging crises that require bold leadership. "Wray’s exit isn’t just about the FBI. It’s about the failure of these so-called leaders to confront the real issues: a global war, economic collapse, and an invasion at the border. They’re too busy protecting their own skins to fight for the country.”

In closing, Bannon made it clear that he sees Wray’s resignation as a defining moment. "This is what surrender looks like,” he said. "Hands up. White flag. And the MAGA movement? We’re just getting started.”

For more context watch this Thursday’s footage: 

“Wray Capitulated To Us”: Bannon On Christopher Wray’s Resignation And Incoming Bombshell Report

title: Bannon and Kelly Blast Biden’s Corruption with Jack Smith: Pardon Plot and Rogue Prosecutors Exposed
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Steve Bannon and Julie Kelly tore into the Biden administration on Friday's WarRoom, accusing it of orchestrating legal overreach to...
content:
Steve Bannon and Julie Kelly tore into the Biden administration on Friday’s WarRoom, accusing it of orchestrating legal overreach to protect its own officials while targeting its political opponents. Together, Bannon and Kelly spotlighted key players in the Democrat Biden administration and smashed the legal system, claiming their combined actions threatened American democracy.

Bannon Dares Biden to Issue Pardons

Bannon wasted no time, opening the conversation with a bold challenge to the Biden administration. He dared the regime to issue blanket pardons for those involved in the politically charged investigations against former President Donald Trump. "We dare you. Try it. Do it. We want to bury these criminals. We want to bury the Democratic Party,” he said, referring to individuals involved in what he called a “criminal” network.

Bannon continued along his line of attack, saying that issuing pardons for these figures would only expose the administration’s corruption and fuel the populist backlash. "They’ve terrorized this country. We dare you to give them blanket pardons,” he said.

Julie Kelly Names Names: Prosecutors and Their Alleged Crimes

Julie Kelly brought even more heat to the discussion, revealing names of individuals who she claims have been part of this alleged conspiracy to target Trump and his allies. She started by naming Jack Smith, the special counsel overseeing the Mar-a-Lago document case. Kelly accused Smith of manipulating the legal process to benefit the Biden administration. "The whole investigation into the so-called classified documents case was conducted in Washington, DC, even though the alleged crime happened in Florida,” Kelly pointed out. She argued that this move was strategic, as Washington judges are more likely to support the case than those in Florida.

"Instead of conducting the investigation in the proper jurisdiction, they did it in Washington, DC,” Kelly continued. "They knew they couldn’t get a rubber-stamp approval in Florida.”

Bannon joined in, criticizing other prosecutors on Smith’s team, including J. Brad, David Harbach, and James Pierce. He asked, "What’s your beef with Jack Smith and J. Brad?” implying these prosecutors were part of a larger political scheme designed to harm Trump. The discussion quickly became focused on what Kelly believes are their real motives: to protect the Biden administration.

Accusations of Legal and Political Manipulation

Kelly accused the Biden administration of using the legal system as a political weapon to protect itself from scrutiny. One of her most significant revelations was the involvement of Biden’s legal team in the investigations. "There’s proof that Jack Smith was taking marching orders from the Biden White House,” she revealed. She cited meetings between Biden’s legal counsel and Smith’s team, pointing to a clear chain of communication that allegedly links the president’s office to these high-profile legal proceedings.

Bannon and Kelly also criticized the ongoing January 6th investigations, accusing the administration of keeping the "jack boots” on the ground to arrest people connected to the event. Bannon warned that these actions would continue unless stopped, painting a grim picture of what he described as a regime that won’t back down until it has destroyed its opposition.

The Rogue’s Gallery: Who Are the Real Criminals?

The conversation took a darker turn as Kelly and Bannon named more figures involved in this web of alleged corruption. Kelly noted the potential risks of preemptive pardons, likening it to the Hunter Biden pardon, which she sees as a way to shield Joe Biden from legal fallout. "A blanket pardon for Jack Smith and his team would be just like the Hunter Biden pardon,” she warned.

Bannon also highlighted some of the other key figures he believes are behind these legal actions. "You’ve got Fauci and his lies about Wuhan, you’ve got Liz Cheney, and now you’ve got Jack Smith and his team,” he said. These individuals, according to Bannon and Kelly, have played central roles in perpetuating a narrative of political persecution and legal overreach.

What’s Next: A Call for Justice

Both Bannon and Kelly concluded the conversation with a call for action. Bannon’s message was clear: the Biden administration must be held accountable for what they see as a corrupt, lawless operation. "They’re not going to stop until you stop it,” Bannon warned, urging the public to stay vigilant.

Kelly echoed Bannon’s sentiments, emphasizing that the only way to expose the corruption was through investigative journalism and legal challenges. "It’s up to us to uncover the truth,” she said, implying that the fight against this alleged injustice was far from over.

Conclusion: A Battle for Democracy

The conversation between Bannon and Kelly paints a picture of a political and legal system where power is misused and the truth is buried. By naming the individuals allegedly behind this corruption and highlighting their actions, they hope to spark a wider conversation about accountability and the state of American democracy. As the WarRoom segment concluded, the message was clear: the battle is far from over, and justice will only be served if the American people stand up and demand it.

For more context, watch this segment from Friday’s WarRoom:

Julie Kelly Demands Investigation Into Jan. 6 Federal Judges

title: Breaking News: WarRoom’s Own Monica Crowley Nominated to be POTUS Trump’s "Patriotism Czar”
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Monica Crowley, a long-time War Room contributor, and former U.S. Treasury official, appeared on the WarRoom with Steve Bannon on...
content:
Monica Crowley, a long-time War Room contributor, and former U.S. Treasury official, appeared on the WarRoom with Steve Bannon on Thursday to give the details of her exciting news, as she has been nominated for a significant new role in President Trump’s second term. Dubbed the "Patriotism Czar,” Crowley’s appointment as Chief of Protocol and Assistant Secretary of State highlights her extensive experience and deep dedication to America.

What Is the Role of Chief of Protocol?

Crowley’s responsibilities as Chief of Protocol go far beyond ceremonial duties. She will oversee critical diplomatic engagements, ensuring seamless interactions between the President, Vice President, and international leaders.

"When heads of state land at Andrews Air Force Base, the first person they’ll see is me,” Crowley explained enthusiastically. She added, "There’s no greater responsibility than representing the United States of America to the world.”

Crowley will brief President Trump and Vice President Vance on global protocols and accompany them on all international trips aboard Air Force One.

Managing Historic Events

In addition to diplomatic duties, Crowley has been tasked with leading preparations for major upcoming events. These include America’s 250th birthday in 2026, the World Cup final in New York/New Jersey, and the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles.

"President Trump has entrusted me with an incredible portfolio,” Crowley said, noting the significance of these global milestones. She described her role as ensuring that the United States shines on the world stage.

From Treasury Official to Patriotism Czar

Crowley previously served as a senior official at the U.S. Treasury Department during Trump’s first term. There, she helped deliver what she calls a "blue-collar boom” through economic policies that benefited all Americans.

Reflecting on her time at Treasury, Crowley said, "I’m extremely proud of the work we did to create a rising economy for every single American.” She also highlighted her involvement in enforcing sanctions, stating, "We targeted bad actors effectively and made a real impact.”

Crowley credited her academic background—a PhD in international relations from Columbia University—and her work at Treasury for preparing her for this new challenge.

"Patriotism Czar”: A Fitting Title

The title "Patriotism Czar” was suggested by a colleague, and Crowley fully embraced it. "I absolutely love that,” she said. "It perfectly captures the spirit of this role. Representing the country I love is a true labor of love.”

Steve Bannon praised Crowley for her qualifications, calling her "a superstar” and "an incredible person.” He added, "President Trump picked well.”

A Lifelong Dedication to America

Crowley emphasized her deep love for the United States. "This country is my heart and soul,” she said. "I’ve dedicated my entire adult life to saving and supporting it.”

She also shared a lighthearted moment about her mother’s reaction to her new role. "My mom said, ‘Finally, you’re putting that Ivy League PhD to use!’” Crowley laughed.

Still Connecting with the War Room Posse

Despite her new responsibilities, Crowley remains committed to her audience. She continues hosting The Monica Crowley Podcast, which is available on major platforms like Rumble, Spotify, and Apple.

"I’m so grateful to Steve [Bannon], this audience, and mostly President Trump for giving me this extraordinary opportunity,” she said.

What’s Next for Crowley?

Crowley must undergo Senate confirmation for her role, and she joked about rallying the War Room Posse for support. Once confirmed, she’ll step into a role of immense responsibility, representing America on the world stage and shaping key international moments.

"This job is a huge thrill,” Crowley said. "I’m honored and humbled to have the chance to serve my country again.”

With her passion, experience, and commitment, Crowley is ready to embrace the challenge. She says, "There’s no greater honor than serving the United States of America.”

For more of our coverage of Monica Crowley:

Kamala Harris Unfit for Office? Monica Crowley’s Scathing Critique of the VP’s Mental Stability

Democratic ‘Ghost Strategy’ Exposed by Monica Crowley: Shadows of Past Leaders and Kamala Harris’s Media Makeover

Kamala Harris Exposed: Ruthless Truancy Policies Hurt Black Families for Financial Gain

Democrats Are Losing Black Voters—Here’s Why They’re Blaming Black Men, Adam Coleman in the WarRoom

Wren Directs GOP to These "Winnable” Races: Targets Key Races for a 54-Seat Senate Majority

And more, search Monca Crowley on WarRoom.org.

For more context about Crowley’s exciting news, watch this Thursday WarRoom segment: 

Monica Crowley Discusses Role In The Trump Administration: “Chief of Protocol”

title: From Bannon’s Recommened Reading List: Capital by Thomas Piketty
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Steve Bannon’s Thursday WarRoom discussion with Phillip Patrick about the collapse of the French government offers a fascinating lens into...
content:
Steve Bannon’s Thursday WarRoom discussion with Phillip Patrick about the collapse of the French government offers a fascinating lens into the broader economic issues facing global powers. Drawing from the events in France, Bannon ties the crisis to Thomas Piketty’s Capital themes, offering a stark warning for the United States.

Resources for this report: 

Capital in the Twenty-First Century

Steve Bannon: End of the Dollar Empire series (Free eBooks) Exclusive Reports on De-Dollarization from Stephen K. Bannon

“Yesterday, The French Government Collapsed”

Bannon opened the discussion by highlighting the no-confidence vote that ousted France’s Prime Minister. He pointed out the rare unity between the far-right and left in this move. "Here’s the lesson, boys and girls,” Bannon said. "The French far-right and left unite in vote to oust the Prime Minister. Why? It’s simple. The system is unsustainable.”

Bannon described the French situation as emblematic of a larger global problem: mounting deficits and unsustainable economic models. He compared France’s predicament to the challenges the U.S. faces with massive spending and slow economic growth.

The Economic Crisis: A Piketty Connection

Bannon linked the collapse in France to Piketty’s analysis in Capital, a book he described as “dense but essential reading.” He highlighted the irony of Piketty’s ideas, rooted in French economic thought, influencing policies that contributed to the government’s fall.

“Isn’t it ironic,” Bannon remarked, “that Piketty’s own country suffers from the very policies he championed? It’s a warning for us here in the U.S.”

He noted that France’s reliance on Modern Monetary Theory (MMT)—the idea that governments can finance deficits by printing money without immediate consequences—was a major factor.

The Dangers of Modern Monetary Theory

Bannon argued that MMT, while tempting, has significant pitfalls. He explained that excessive deficit spending under MMT erodes investor confidence, leading to financial instability. "France shows us the limitations of this approach,” Bannon said. "Debt might not matter to governments, but it does to investors. And they’re speaking loud and clear.”

He warned that the U.S. could face similar issues if leaders continue down this path. "We’re adding a trillion dollars in debt every 100 days,” Bannon said. "The model’s unsustainable. Without serious reforms, we’ll find ourselves in a situation like France’s.”

A Call to Action for the U.S.

Bannon emphasized the need for the U.S. to learn from France’s mistakes. He proposed focusing on reducing deficits, reforming tax policies, and controlling spending. "We need to act before it’s too late,” he said.

Patrick echoed these sentiments, urging Americans to educate themselves on economic issues. He praised Bannon’s efforts to raise awareness, saying, "This is about empowering people to understand the stakes.”

Why Capital Still Matters

Bannon’s reference to Capital wasn’t just a critique. He acknowledged its importance in understanding wealth inequality and economic dynamics. "It’s dense, sure, but it’s essential reading,” Bannon said. "If we’re going to fix these issues, we need to understand how we got here.”

Conclusion: A Warning and a Path Forward

Bannon and Patrick used the French crisis as a cautionary tale for the U.S., blending economic theory with real-world events. Their message was clear: without reforms, the U.S. risks a similar collapse. As Bannon put it, "The time to act is now, or we’ll be the next headline.”

A basic summary of the book: 
Capital by Thomas Piketty is an influential book on economics that examines wealth inequality and the dynamics of capital accumulation over time. Officially titled Capital in the Twenty-First Century, the book delves into how wealth has been distributed historically, the forces driving economic inequality, and the implications for modern economies.

Key Themes and Ideas:

  1. Historical Analysis of Inequality Piketty uses historical data, spanning centuries and multiple countries, to track income and wealth distribution trends. He argues that the concentration of wealth in the hands of a few is not an anomaly but a recurring pattern in capitalist economies.
  2. The Role of Capital and Inheritance A central thesis is the formula r>gr > gr>g, where r (the rate of return on capital) typically exceeds g (the rate of economic growth). When this happens, wealth grows faster than income, leading to increased inequality. Piketty highlights how inherited wealth often plays a more significant role than earned income in perpetuating economic divides.
  3. Economic Inequality and Its Consequences The book outlines how extreme inequality can undermine democratic values and social stability. Piketty explores the social and political risks of wealth concentration, such as reduced economic mobility and the erosion of meritocracy.
  4. Proposed Solutions To counter rising inequality, Piketty suggests policy measures like progressive taxation on income and wealth, as well as global coordination to implement taxes on capital, particularly on large fortunes.
  5. Comparison to Karl Marx’s Capital While the title nods to Karl Marx’s Capital, Piketty’s approach is different. He relies on empirical data rather than Marx’s theoretical framework, and his focus is more on wealth inequality than on class struggle or the labor-capital relationship.

Reception and Impact:

The book, published in 2013 (originally in French), became a global sensation. It sparked widespread debate about economic inequality and the role of government in addressing it. Critics praised Piketty’s rigorous analysis and accessible writing, though some economists have questioned his conclusions or the feasibility of his policy recommendations.

In essence, Capital challenges readers to reconsider the nature of wealth accumulation, inequality, and the policies needed to create a fairer economic system in the 21st century.

For more context on the Thursday discussion between Pattrick and Bannon, watch this segment: 

Phillip Patrick: The U.S. Top Priority Should Be Getting Spending Under Control

title: Bannon Unleashes about Tariffs at DEFCON 1: Kevin O’Leary’s Call to Action Sparks Media Panic Frenzy
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: DEFCON ONE: Economic Warfare with China Major Sea Change on CNN: Bannon Declares "We Own the High Ground" Media Forced...
content:
DEFCON ONE: Economic Warfare with China

Major Sea Change on CNN: Bannon Declares “We Own the High Ground”

Media Forced to Defend CCP

Bannon blasted legacy media for defending globalist interests. "We’ve backed them into a corner. They’re now defending a system that’s failed American workers,” he said. The shift, he argued, exposes Wall Street’s exploitation of vulnerable U.S. workers to drive down wages.

Resources for this report:

DEFCON Levels
What Is a Tariff and Why Are They Important?

Kevin O’Leary Sparks Debate on CNN

Kevin O’Leary, sometimes called Mr. Wonderful, is a Canadian politician, businessman, investor, journalist, author, and television personality,  ignited a firestorm on CNN, calling for "DEFCON ONE” economic measures against the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) on Tuesday.

"Target parts of their economy where there’s a lot of workers,” O’Leary stated, proposing tariffs that hit sectors like yoga mat production to provoke domestic unrest in China. He added, "We’ve had strategies since ‘99. Enough is enough.”

Watch:

Bannon Celebrates Media Shift

On Wednesday ,host  Steve Bannon seized on O’Leary’s remarks during WarRoom, declaring a "major sea change” in public discourse. "For the first time since 2015, it wasn’t just unchained hatred. It was sophisticated policy discussion,” Bannon noted, highlighting a rare focus on tariffs, trade, and economics across mainstream outlets like MSNBC and CNN.

Tariffs as a Blunt Tool

Recalling Trump-era tariffs, Bannon emphasized their impact: "When President Trump said, ‘I’ve had it with fentanyl and 70,000 deaths,’ Mexico and China got the message. Tariffs are a blunt tool, but they work.”

High-Stakes Economic Warfare

Bannon hailed O’Leary’s bold stance as a call to action. "Kevin O’Leary gets it. Put 25% tariffs on the CCP now, and you’ll break their economy,” he urged. According to Bannon, such measures would boost wages for American workers while pressuring China’s regime.

The Moral High Ground

Declaring victory in the battle of ideas, Bannon said, "We own the moral high ground. This is about bringing back jobs and defending our citizens. They’re just stooges for corporate oligarchs.”

As Bannon frames it, the fight against the CCP is economic and moral, signaling a pivotal shift in U.S. policy and public opinion. “DEFCON ONE starts now,” he declared.

Expanding Economic Patriotism: A Movement Gains Momentum

Bannon doubled down on the necessity of economic nationalism, stressing that tariffs are only the beginning. “This isn’t just about balancing trade deficits,” he said. “It’s about dismantling a system that prioritizes corporate profits over American livelihoods.” Bannon’s vision ties into broader efforts to revitalize domestic manufacturing and rebuild working-class communities.

He also highlighted the role of accountability in this economic war. “China’s economy is teetering because of their overreliance on exploitative practices. A trillion dollars injected into local economies won’t solve their problems if the global tide shifts against them.” Bannon’s strategy mirrors the boldness of Trump-era policies that leveraged economic tools to reassert America’s dominance.

Global Implications: Allies and Adversaries React

The tariffs debate isn’t limited to the U.S.-China axis. Bannon emphasized the need for cooperation with Mexico and Canada, particularly under the USMCA. “Trump showed what’s possible with pressure and negotiation. We need to replicate that success.” He also warned against appeasement strategies by European allies, arguing that a unified Western front is essential to counter China’s influence.

“This is the new 1932 moment,” he said, referencing the Great Depression’s impact on global economic realignments. “It’s not just policy—it’s survival.”

Bannon’s WarRoom Breaks Down Trump Tariffs and the Fight for American Prosperity

title: Urgent Warning: Farage and Bannon Expose Dangerous Global Shifts – U.S. Must Act Now
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Key Issues at Play In a critical exchange on Monday's WarRoom, Steve Bannon and Nigel Farage addressed two major global concerns—rising tensions...
content:
Key Issues at Play

In a critical exchange on Monday’s WarRoom, Steve Bannon and Nigel Farage addressed two major global concerns—rising tensions in Ukraine and a potential loss of one of America’s most important military assets, Diego Garcia. Farage and Bannon discussed how these developments are not just distant issues but could drastically impact American security and international power dynamics. Here’s why Americans should pay attention and what Farage is asking for.

Resources for this Situation Report:

Video- Diego Garcia: The Strategic U.S Military Base in Indian Ocean

Reform Party UK- Nigel Farage

Nigel Farage Calls for Action: Bannon Pledges Support in Fight Against Banking Elites

Bannon’s Warnings on Ukraine Escalation

Bannon sounded the alarm on the dangerously escalating conflict in Ukraine. With only 56 days left before the Trump administration takes office, Bannon expressed deep concern over the current state of affairs. He believes the recent actions by global leaders—especially those supporting further military escalation—are pushing the world to the brink of a catastrophic conflict. The situation, according to Bannon, is now more perilous than any time since World War II. His message? The geopolitical tensions in Ukraine, fueled by the Biden administration’s actions, could have disastrous consequences.

Bannon’s frustration is evident. He sees political leaders using the situation to undermine Donald Trump’s potential peace-making efforts, driven by spite rather than rational governance. Bannon warns that this could make the world even more dangerous. His call to action is clear: the U.S. needs to shift its approach and focus on de-escalation before it’s too late.

Farage Exposes the Risk to Diego Garcia

Nigel Farage highlighted another urgent issue: the potential surrender of Diego Garcia to Mauritius. Diego Garcia, located in the Indian Ocean, is one of America’s most strategically important military assets. It is used as a vital U.S. base for operations across the globe. However, Farage revealed that the British government is working to cede control of the island to Mauritius, a move he deems driven by "postcolonial guilt.”

Farage argues that this decision would weaken American influence in the region at a time when China is rapidly expanding its global reach. Giving up Diego Garcia could result in China gaining more control over the area, further challenging U.S. military dominance and global security. Farage is furious about this potential betrayal of American interests and is asking U.S. leaders to take immediate action.

A Call for American Intervention

Farage’s warning isn’t just about a distant military base; it’s about the broader implications for global stability and U.S. security. He is asking for the incoming Trump administration to take action and make its opposition clear. Farage wants American voices—especially from powerful figures like Senator Marco Rubio—to speak out loud and clear against the UK’s plans. He believes that without a strong stance from the U.S., the British government might rush this decision, finalizing the deal before Trump takes office.

"This is not just a British problem; this is an American problem,” Farage emphasized. "If we don’t stop this, the U.S. will lose a vital strategic asset, and the world will be a more dangerous place.”

The Consequences of Inaction

Farage and Bannon’s conversation paints a troubling picture of a world where geopolitical tensions are left unchecked. If the U.S. doesn’t prevent these shifts, America’s ability to influence global events and maintain strategic dominance could be significantly undermined. Farage fears that without immediate action, America’s position on the world stage will weaken, and global security will suffer.

What Americans Can Do Now

The time to act is now. Farage is urging Americans to join him in calling for a halt to the plans for Diego Garcia. He stresses that it’s not just about protecting a military base—it’s about safeguarding U.S. interests and ensuring a balanced global power structure. He’s asking for American voices to rise and push back against these dangerous moves before it’s too late.

For those who want to stay informed, Farage directs people to his website, where they can follow updates on this developing story. The stakes are high, and the need for American involvement has never been greater, Farage told Bannon.

Conclusion: Why This Matters for Americans

The exchange between Bannon and Farage serves as a wake-up call for the United States. The potential loss of Diego Garcia and the escalating situation in Ukraine are not just distant problems—they are ones that will shape America’s future security and influence. Farage is asking for urgent support from American leaders to prevent these risks from materializing. For the sake of global stability and American power, now is the time for action. The question remains: Will U.S. leaders take a stand before it’s too late?

For more context on this conversation between Bannon and Farage watch this segment from Monday’s WarRoom:

Nigel Farage Warns The Globalists’ Escalation Has Placed Globe At Most Dangerous Levels Since 1945

title: WarRoom’s Mission “Impoundment” Report: Understand Checks and Balances- Returning D.C. to the People’s Government
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: A Vision for Change Washington, D.C., must return to its roots—a government of, by, and for the people—accountable, balanced, and...
content:
A Vision for Change

Washington, D.C., must return to its roots—a government of, by, and for the people—accountable, balanced, and transparent. Steve Bannon and constitutional advocates like Mark Paoletta from the Center for Renewing America are pushing for this with bold ideas to restore checks and balances- on Thursday’s WarRoom.

Resources for this report understand the Constitutional Power of Impoundment:

Restoring Checks and Balances

Bannon’s message is clear: "The Constitution gives us the framework; we just need to enforce it.” On Thrusday while talking to Paoletta, he emphasized the importance of checks and balances, explaining how current systems fail. Congress is too often a bystander, allowing unchecked power in the executive branch.

The solution? Congress must reclaim its role. Bannon underscored, “It’s about accountability. No one person or office should dominate. That’s what our Founders intended.”

Impoundment: The Forgotten Power

What is impoundment? It’s a president’s ability to refuse to spend funds appropriated by Congress. Bannon and constitutional voices believe it’s a key to stopping wasteful government overreach.

Critics call it extreme, but advocates like Bannon disagree. "Impoundment is not radical,” he explained. "It’s a tool to ensure taxpayer dollars are spent responsibly.”

Impoundment, a term that once held significant weight in American governance, has resurfaced in recent discussions about restoring balance between the executive and legislative branches.  Bannon, along with Mark Paoletta other constitutional advocates, has argued strongly for the reassertion of impoundment powers. Impoundment allows the President to refuse to spend funds that Congress has allocated, essentially putting a check on potentially wasteful or unnecessary government expenditures.

In their discussion Thursday in the WarRoom, Bannon stressed that this power is rooted in the Constitution, which empowers Congress to control the purse. However, over time, presidents have largely bypassed this tool, choosing to work within a system where they don’t have to confront Congress on spending decisions. Bannon pointed out, "The Founders intended for checks on the executive, and impoundment is one of the most powerful tools Congress has—yet it’s rarely used.” He emphasized that this power isn’t about overreach; instead, it’s a measure of fiscal responsibility and control.

The need for impoundment is especially critical today, as government spending has soared to unsustainable levels. Bannon and others believe that by reintroducing impoundment, presidents would be forced to justify their spending more carefully. This, in turn, would encourage the executive branch to work more closely with Congress, ensuring that every dollar spent aligns with the people’s needs rather than executive preferences. Bannon argued, “Impoundment isn’t radical. It’s a tool to ensure taxpayer dollars are spent responsibly.”

Critics of impoundment, however, argue that it could undermine Congressional authority, essentially giving the President unilateral power to withhold funds. But Bannon and his allies maintain that the executive must be accountable, and Congress must reclaim its responsibility to oversee government spending. The goal, as they see it, is to restore the checks and balances that keep the federal government in check and ensure it truly serves the people.

Highlighting this, checks on reckless spending could dramatically limit executive overreach, returning financial power to Congress where it belongs.

Why This Matters

This approach isn’t just about saving money. It’s about restoring the balance of power. Without it, the people lose control over how their money is used.

The People’s Government

Washington DC doesn’t belong to the elites. It belongs to you. Let’s take it back.  The America First movement isn’t about partisanship. It’s about accountability. Returning D.C. to the people is a non-negotiable.

Mark Paoletta Previews The Incoming Fight President Trump Must Bear

title: Bannon Fires Back After Judge Denies Trial Delay: “The Hunted Are About to Become the Hunters
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Steve Bannon, the former White House strategist and close ally of President Donald Trump, is facing serious charges in New...
content:
Steve Bannon, the former White House strategist and close ally of President Donald Trump, is facing serious charges in New York over his involvement in the “We Build the Wall” campaign. However, despite the weight of the allegations, Bannon remains defiant and unapologetic, vowing to continue his fight against what he describes as a politically motivated attack on his character and mission.

One woman close to the story, who was involved with the project, posted on social media a statement in support of Bannon on Tuesday:

On Tuesday, Bannon appeared in a New York courtroom as Judge April Newbauer declined to delay his upcoming trial, which is set for December 9. Bannon is charged with defrauding supporters who donated to the online campaign aimed at funding a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border. Prosecutors claim that some of the $15 million raised was diverted for personal use by Bannon and the campaign’s president, Brian Kolfage.

According to ABC News, while the defense team sought to delay the trial until January to address new evidence presented by the prosecution, the judge did not grant the request. However, Newbauer left open the possibility of adjusting the trial schedule after a hearing next Monday. The prosecution asserts that the evidence will not lengthen the trial, which is expected to last about a week.

Bannon’s legal team, led by defense attorney John Carman, has pushed back strongly, arguing that they need more time to properly counter the new evidence. Carman also suggested that Bannon’s co-defendants in a related federal case could be called to testify in his defense, possibly shedding new light on the case.

ABC News reported that for his part, Bannon has consistently denied the charges and maintains that the funds he received from the “We Build the Wall” campaign were for legitimate expenses. “The money that he was taking was money he was entitled to take,” Carman argued in court, emphasizing Bannon’s belief that he was reimbursed for his work in the campaign.

Outside the courtroom on Tuesday, Bannon clarified that he sees this legal battle as part of a broader political struggle. As he walked from the courthouse, Bannon took a moment to address reporters and denounce what he called “lawfare” – the weaponization of the legal system for political gain. "The people rendered their verdict on this lawfare last Tuesday,” he said, referring to the outcome of the recent election. "The hunted are about to become the hunters.”

Bannon’s comments highlighted his belief that the American people have already spoken out against the political establishment and its ongoing attacks on him and others aligned with the populist-nationalist movement. "Working-class people, all over the country, came together and rejected what’s going on in this court,” he continued. "The lawfare of Letitia James, Alvin Bragg, Jack Smith, and Merrick Garland has been rejected by a landslide by the American people.”

Bannon’s defiance is not new. He has faced significant legal challenges in recent years, including a four-month prison sentence for contempt of Congress after refusing to comply with a subpoena related to the January 6th Capitol attack. Despite these setbacks, Bannon remains steadfast in his commitment to the causes he champions, including the “America First” agenda and a fight against what he perceives as a corrupt political system.

Bannon’s trial is set to be a pivotal moment in his ongoing battle with the legal system. While the outcome remains uncertain, it’s clear that Bannon intends to fight back with all the political capital and public support he can muster.

For more context:

Steve Bannon Press Conference Nov 12, 2024

title: The Unseen War: Benny Johnson and Steve Bannon Expose GOP Senate Power Struggle
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: New Media vs. Old Guard Steve Bannon and Benny Johnson launched a bold conversation on Monday's WarRoom that is destined...
content:
New Media vs. Old Guard

Steve Bannon and Benny Johnson launched a bold conversation on Monday’s WarRoom that is destined to resonate across the political landscape, with Bannon praising Johnson’s work as “changing the arc of history.” Their conversation exposes a new reality: conservative media figures like Johnson challenge legacy media, shaping public discourse in ways the traditional outlets can’t ignore. “This is not the same world for the broadcast networks,” Bannon argued, affirming the emerging power of independent voices that don’t hesitate to take on Capitol Hill.

If you are angry about this report, contact: 

US Senate

Exposing the GOP’s Senate “Whip Count”

Benny Johnson’s latest report focuses on Senate leadership and the "whip count,” revealing where senators’ loyalties lie. He highlighted how some GOP senators are supporting anti-Trump leaders like John Thune and John Cornyn behind closed doors, a move Johnson describes as a betrayal of MAGA principles. “This is a despicable insult to the American people,” Johnson declared, criticizing these senators for their lack of transparency. Johnson’s findings suggest that support for anti-Trump figures isn’t based on constituent interests but on maintaining Senate power structures.

See Johnson’s post:

Secret Votes and Hidden Loyalties

One of the most shocking revelations was Johnson’s claim that GOP senators plan to vote for leaders like Thune and Cornyn in a "dark of night” vote, hidden from public scrutiny. “Have you ever seen a U.S. senator shy away from the cameras?” Johnson asked, highlighting the absence of vocal support for these controversial candidates. According to Johnson, these senators avoid public endorsements for Thune or Cornyn because they fear backlash from their pro-Trump constituents. This secrecy, Bannon and Johnson agree, is a major red flag.

Betrayal of the MAGA Movement?

For Johnson and Bannon, supporting anti-Trump figures within the GOP represents a deep betrayal of the movement’s values. Many of these senators, Johnson noted, won their seats with Trump’s endorsement and the hard work of MAGA supporters. “This is an outright betrayal of MAGA,” Bannon affirmed, urging viewers to recognize the implications of senators siding with leaders who opposed Trump’s agenda. The fallout from these "hidden votes” could impact the future of the GOP’s alignment with its base.

“The Real Mainstream Media”

Bannon claimed that voices like Johnson’s have become "the real mainstream media,” taking the lead in driving political narratives once monopolized by billion-dollar media conglomerates. The rise of streaming, podcasts, and direct engagement has given figures like Bannon and Johnson unprecedented influence. Their core message: with each revelation, independent media is proving itself as a powerful alternative to conventional reporting.

A Call to Action: Demand Transparency

As a final call to action, Bannon urged his audience to contact their senators and demand transparency. He shared the U.S. Senate switchboard number, emphasizing the importance of a public vote on Senate leadership. For Johnson and Bannon, this is about accountability. If Senate Republicans want to move against Trump, Bannon argued, they should be willing to do it publicly, rather than hiding their votes.

Power of Independent Reporting

Johnson’s work highlights the growing strength of independent reporting in holding power to account. He noted that some senators, rather than embracing the new wave of conservative media, remain loyal to traditional media outlets like CNN, believing them to be the ultimate authority. Bannon, however, sees this as a miscalculation, noting that senators who align themselves with independent voices are "beginning to see real power ascend to them.”

“No One Can Touch McConnell”?

Johnson’s investigation also exposed McConnell’s enduring influence over the Senate, which Johnson compared to a "terrorist” stronghold within the GOP. Johnson insists that even McConnell, long seen as untouchable, is now vulnerable to the power of public scrutiny. “No one said we could touch Ronna, but look where she is now,” Bannon added, underscoring how public pressure has shifted GOP power dynamics in recent months.

The Road Ahead

As Bannon and Johnson wrapped up their explosive exchange, one message stood clear: independent media has the power to shift public opinion and hold political elites accountable. Bannon emphasized the importance of "fighting an information war,” one in which transparency and truth are critical. Johnson vowed to continue his investigation, promising to bring the "whip count” into the public eye—no matter the obstacles.

In an era where traditional and new media are locked in a battle for influence, Bannon and Johnson’s conversation underscores a shift in who controls the narrative. With each report, Johnson and Bannon are redefining the boundaries of political accountability, leveraging independent media’s power to keep voters informed and engaged.
