title: Grassroots Revolution: How Local Engagement Is Shaping the 2024 Elections
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Grassroots movements are crucial for winning elections, as demonstrated by their historical success for Democrats and the Trump campaign in...
content:
Grassroots movements are crucial for winning elections, as demonstrated by their historical success for Democrats and the Trump campaign in 2016. As the 2024 election approaches, Trump and his allies emphasize the need for local engagement to drive voter turnout and reclaim political power. Caroline Wren joined the Monday WarRoom to give some details of how Election 2024 is going so far. 

The Power of Grassroots Movements

Grassroots efforts have consistently played a pivotal role in shaping American elections. From the civil rights movement to the recent successes of Democrats, local engagement is key to mobilizing support and driving voter turnout.

In 2016, Donald Trump’s campaign harnessed the power of grassroots activism to rally a diverse coalition of voters. His ability to connect with everyday Americans, fueled by a robust ground game, propelled him to victory against the odds. As Caroline Wren noted on "War Room,” "Grassroots efforts are essential. We need to get involved and fight for our future.”

The Current Landscape: Arizona as a Case Study

In Monday’s conversation, Wren pointed out the concerning state of voter registration in Arizona. "There are 218,000 unconfirmed U.S. citizens on the voter rolls,” she revealed. This raises questions about election integrity and highlights the importance of local vigilance.

Wren expressed frustration over the lack of legal representation for the Arizona Republican Party, emphasizing that without action, the party risks losing ground. "We need to hold our leaders accountable,” she urged, underscoring the urgency of grassroots involvement.

Economic Inequality and Political Disconnection

Dave Brat, also on "War Room,” discussed the broader economic implications of grassroots movements. He stated, "The top 10 percent own 90 percent of the stocks.” This stark inequality contributes to a growing disconnection between the elite and the average American.

Brat’s remarks highlight a significant concern: as the wealth gap widens, grassroots movements are more important than ever. They serve as a counterbalance to elite influence in politics, empowering everyday citizens to reclaim their voice.

Campaign Financing and Corporate Influence

Wren also addressed the impact of corporate financing on elections, stating, "Our members of Congress are so controlled by the money.” This financial stranglehold makes it critical for grassroots movements to mobilize support at the local level.

Campaign financing often skews political priorities, making it essential for voters to engage and advocate for their interests. Local efforts can help counter corporate influence and ensure that elected officials are held accountable.

The Path Forward: Mobilizing Grassroots Support

As the 2024 election looms, Trump and his allies call for renewed grassroots engagement. The mantra is clear: "Get involved. Register to vote. Make your voice heard.”

Grassroots movements have historically succeeded because they resonate with the electorate’s frustrations and aspirations. Trump’s campaign is leveraging this strategy, encouraging supporters to participate actively in their communities and advocate for their beliefs.

A Call to Activism

The upcoming elections present a critical opportunity for grassroots movements to shape the political landscape. By engaging locally, citizens can hold their leaders accountable and advocate for a future that aligns with their values.

As Wren aptly stated, "We must fight for our future.” The success of the 2024 elections hinges on grassroots efforts that connect with voters and inspire action. Now is the time for Americans to rise and reclaim their power through local engagement and activism.

title: The US Dollar Has Lost 20% of Its Value Under Kamala Harris – Here’s Why That Matters to Voters
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: According to economic experts, The Biden-Harris administration’s economic policies have eroded the value of the US dollar by 20% since...
content:
According to economic experts, The Biden-Harris administration’s economic policies have eroded the value of the US dollar by 20% since 2020. This inflation crisis directly impacts voters’ wallets, wages, and savings, making it a pivotal issue for the November election. Voters must take this seriously in November.

Inflation Has Eaten Away at the Dollar

On Monday, EJ Antoni appeared on the WarRoom program and emphasized a critical point: "The dollar has lost a fifth of its value since Biden-Harris took office.” This shocking 20% loss is directly tied to the administration’s reckless fiscal policies, including multi-trillion-dollar deficits and unchecked government spending.

Inflation has hit American households hard. Groceries, gas, rent—all have become more expensive, eroding the dollar’s purchasing power. According to Antoni, even the government’s metrics, which understate inflation, show a significant decline in the dollar’s value. "This is where the government has gotten all the money to pay for its runaway spending,” Antoni explained. Inflation acts as a hidden tax, and voters are paying the price.

Voters Are Feeling the Pinch

Why does this matter for voters heading to the polls in November? The value of your wages, savings, and investments has been slashed. As inflation continues to rise, everyday necessities are becoming increasingly unaffordable. Many Americans are left wondering how they’ll maintain their standard of living if the dollar keeps losing value.

The erosion of the dollar is not just an abstract economic concept—it’s a kitchen table issue. Families struggle with higher costs while their incomes fail to keep pace. "We are all demonstrably poorer because of the policies of this administration,” Antoni stated. This growing financial strain has voters reconsidering their political choices.

Harris’s Policies Are Driving Economic Pain

The root cause of this crisis? The Biden-Harris administration’s fiscal irresponsibility. The two-plus trillion-dollar deficits each year are driving inflation and devaluing the dollar. "Biden and Harris are running $2 trillion deficits right now,” Bannon noted. The government’s excessive borrowing and spending are unsustainable and detrimental to Americans’ financial well-being.

Adding to this, the job market is suffering. Many of the jobs created during Harris’s term have gone to illegal workers or are part-time positions. Antoni pointed out that “all net job growth since before the pandemic has gone to illegal workers,” leaving many Americans sidelined in the job market. This further exacerbates the economic pain felt by working-class families.

What Voters Should Consider in November

As voters head to the polls, they should reflect on the past four years of economic hardship. Inflation, wage stagnation, and a weakened dollar are all the direct results of misguided fiscal policies. The erosion of the US dollar means that voters’ wages and savings are worth less now than before Harris took office.

This is a critical issue for voters to consider in November. The question is simple: Can you afford another four years of policies that are shrinking your paycheck and making it harder to make ends meet?

In a nation built on financial freedom and opportunity, the dollar’s loss of value threatens the core of the American Dream.

title: Urgent Warning: U.S. Leadership and World Stability at Stake in 2024 Election
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: According to Brian Kennedy from the Present Danger China organization, the U.S. faces growing threats from Iran and China, which...
content:
According to Brian Kennedy from the Present Danger China organization, the U.S. faces growing threats from Iran and China, which are undermining its global deterrence. He explained on Wednesday’s WarRoom program that voters must be aware of the implications as the 2024 election nears and said that grassroots mobilization is crucial to influencing the future of U.S. foreign policy.

U.S. Policies Fuel Global Instability

Kennedy warns that current U.S. policies are contributing to global chaos, especially concerning Iran’s aggressions towards Israel. He states, "The United States is helping underwrite the attack on Israel,” pointing out that American funding to Iran indirectly supports these hostilities. This, he argues, isn’t simply a regional issue but part of a broader global challenge that voters must recognize. U.S. leadership, he asserts, is not taking sufficient action to deter Iran, and this failure could have catastrophic consequences.

Failed Deterrence Weakens U.S. Global Standing

Kennedy emphasizes that the erosion of U.S. deterrence is not limited to the Middle East. He highlights a troubling trend where adversaries, particularly China, do not respect America’s warnings. "Iran does not respect the United States, and neither does China,” he says, underscoring how both countries continue to pursue aggressive policies despite U.S. opposition. This is a direct result of weak leadership, Kennedy argues, leaving the U.S. in a vulnerable position.

World War III Looms as Real Threat

Perhaps the most alarming of Kennedy’s warnings is his belief that the world is inching closer to a global conflict. He suggests that the U.S.’s inability to prevent Iran’s provocations could spark a larger confrontation. “This October surprise really could be the start of World War III,” Kennedy cautions. With tensions escalating, particularly in the Middle East, the U.S. may soon face difficult decisions regarding its involvement in new conflicts. Voters need to understand the gravity of the situation as they head to the polls.

Domestic Unrest Could Escalate

Kennedy also connects international instability to potential domestic unrest. If U.S. policies lead to increased violence in the Middle East, he warns that it could trigger significant disruptions at home. “Palestinian sympathizers and Iranians in the U.S. could create the kind of street violence we saw in 2020,” Kennedy explains. The implications for national security are significant, as instability abroad could spill over into the U.S., complicating an already fraught political landscape.

Grassroots Mobilization Is Essential

As the 2024 election approaches, Kennedy stresses the importance of voter engagement, especially among supporters of former President Donald Trump. He reveals a startling statistic: many Trump supporters are not even registered to vote. “People donate money to President Trump and are not registered to vote,” he states, highlighting the disconnect between political support and electoral participation. He urges voters to mobilize their communities, saying, “This will be fixed by the WarRoom Posse animating family, friends, and neighbors.”

Why This Matters Now

Kennedy’s insights underscore the urgent need for American voters to consider the broader implications of U.S. foreign policy. With the U.S.’s global standing weakening and adversaries growing bolder, the stakes for the 2024 election are incredibly high. Weak deterrence, escalating global conflicts, and potential domestic unrest all hinge on the decisions voters make in the coming months.

 2024 Election Is a Crucial Turning Point

Kennedy’s message is clear: the future of U.S. leadership and world stability rests on the outcome of the 2024 election. Voters must take action, not only by voting themselves but by ensuring their communities are engaged. The risks of failing to act—both globally and domestically—are too great to ignore. This is a critical moment in history, and the choices made in the voting booth will determine whether the U.S. can reclaim its position as a global leader.

The time to act is now, Kennedy told WarRoom host Ben Harnwell.

title: Oklahoma’s Biblical Move: Ryan Walters Leads the Nation to Bring Bibles Back to Schools
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Ryan Walters, Oklahoma’s state superintendent of education, appeared on Tuesday WarRoom, and talked about spearheading a groundbreaking initiative to distribute...
content:
Ryan Walters, Oklahoma’s state superintendent of education, appeared on Tuesday WarRoom, and talked about spearheading a groundbreaking initiative to distribute Bibles to every classroom in the state. His efforts not only aim to revitalize the teaching of American history but also seek to inspire similar initiatives nationwide, echoing support from influential figures like President Trump. Walters emphasizes the need for educational reform to combat leftist ideologies infiltrating schools, aiming to restore traditional values and a true understanding of America’s past.

A Vision for Educational Reform

Ryan Walters is determined to reshape Oklahoma’s educational landscape by ensuring every classroom has a copy of the Bible. In a recent discussion, he stated, "We allocated $3 million here in the state to make sure every single classroom has a copy of the Bible.” This initiative is not just about distributing books; it’s a strategic move to reinforce the historical significance of the Bible in American culture. Walters insists that students need to "understand the role the Bible played in American history” to grasp what makes the nation great.

Overcoming Opposition

Walters has faced considerable opposition from various quarters, including teachers’ unions and radical leftist groups. He remarked, "The teachers unions have fought us; the radical Marxist Democrats have funds, but it’s going to happen.” Despite these challenges, he remains steadfast in his mission, driven by the support he receives from parents and community members who want to counter what he describes as "left-wing indoctrination in the classroom.”

According to Walters, this fight is not just localized to Oklahoma but is a broader battle against a leftist agenda that seeks to distort American history and values. He argues, "If you’re not facing stark opposition to what you’re doing, you’re not doing enough.” By taking a stand, Walters believes he is pushing back against a concerted effort to undermine American principles in education.

Inspiring National Change

Walters is confident that Oklahoma’s initiative will serve as a model for other states. He asserts, "We are going to be so proud here… to be the first state in the country to bring the Bible back to every single classroom.” His ambition is to encourage other states to adopt similar policies, creating a ripple effect across the nation. "Every state should be doing this,” he stated, underscoring the need for a collective movement to reclaim educational values.

Support from President Trump has further amplified Walters’ efforts. He noted that Trump has praised their initiative, which aligns with the former president’s broader goals of restoring traditional educational values. With Trump’s backing, Walters believes their project will gain traction, positioning Oklahoma at the forefront of a national educational reform movement.

The Fight Against Leftist Ideologies

Walters is adamant about the ideological battles currently playing out in schools. He argued, "The Democrats have pushed graphic pornography on your kids. They have told your kids that there are different genders.” He believes that the left’s agenda is fundamentally at odds with the values that he and many Oklahomans hold dear. By reintroducing the Bible into schools, Walters aims to counteract this perceived moral decay, emphasizing the need for students to "understand America’s greatness.”

Furthermore, he is vocal about the urgency of this initiative, especially in light of upcoming elections. "We have to get that done,” Walters insisted, indicating that the current political climate presents a unique opportunity to enact meaningful change. He views his efforts as part of a larger fight against what he describes as a "Marxist dumpster fire” threatening the nation’s core values.

Return to the Bible

Ryan Walters’ initiative to put Bibles in Oklahoma classrooms represents a bold step toward reclaiming educational standards and values. With significant financial backing and a commitment to overcoming opposition, Walters aims to inspire other states to follow suit. His collaboration with President Trump amplifies the significance of this movement, marking it as a pivotal moment in the fight against leftist ideologies in American education. As Walters passionately stated, "We will not back down to the woke mob,” signaling a determined effort to restore what he believes is a crucial part of America’s heritage.

For more context, watch Tuesday’s full interview with Ryan Walters:

Ryan Walters: “We’re Not Going To Allow Them To Turn This Country Into A Marxist Dumpster Fire.”

title: Powerful Warning in Spanish AD: “Don’t You Dare Vote”, The Urgent Call for the SAVE Act to Combat Illegal Voting
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Defending American Democracy Mike Davis appeared on Bannon's WarRoom on Monday to discuss his support of the SAVE Act, which...
content:
Defending American Democracy

Mike Davis appeared on Bannon’s WarRoom on Monday to discuss his support of the SAVE Act, which seeks to safeguard American elections by mandating proof of citizenship for voter registration. As illegal voting remains a contentious issue, organizations like the Article III Project are actively campaigning to raise awareness about the serious consequences of illegal voting through targeted advertisements. With a potential 20 million illegal immigrants in the U.S. and allegations of widespread non-citizen voting, the urgency for legislative action is paramount, according to Davis.

The integrity of U.S. elections is under scrutiny, and Davis, a prominent legal advocate and founder of the Article III Project, is at the forefront of the fight for election integrity. On Monday, Davis discussed the implications of the SAVE Act, which requires proof of citizenship to register to vote. He stated, “It is illegal to vote in federal elections if you are a non-citizen; it is almost always a federal crime.”

This crucial legislation ensures that only eligible voters participate in the electoral process, thereby preserving the sanctity of American democracy.

We Know Non-Citizens are Voting

Davis’s comments come from alarming reports highlighting non-citizen voting in key states. He pointed out that recent findings from Virginia and Texas revealed that thousands of non-citizens had been found on voter rolls, raising serious questions about the electoral process. He explained, “Governor Glenn Youngkin has discovered 6,000 non-citizens voting illegally in Virginia, while Governor Greg Abbott has identified 2,000 non-citizens in Texas. This is not just a coincidence; it’s a trend we need to address.”

Article Three Project’s Ad for Spanish-Speaking Potential Voters

To combat the threat of illegal voting, the Article III Project has launched a nationwide advertising campaign to educate the public about the potential consequences of participating in elections as a non-citizen. Davis noted the significance of these ads, stating, “We have put out a 30-second public service announcement in Spanish to convey the message that it is illegal for non-citizens to vote in federal elections.” This strategic move aims to reach both English and Spanish-speaking audiences, ensuring that the message resonates with a broader demographic.

The ad campaign serves not only to inform but also to deter non-citizens from voting. Davis elaborated, “We want to make it clear that illegal voting can lead to serious repercussions, including deportation.” By raising awareness about the legal ramifications of illegal voting, the Article III Project seeks to dissuade non-citizens from participating in the electoral process and encourage compliance with existing laws.

Davis also highlighted the resistance faced by the SAVE Act from Democratic lawmakers. He stated, "The Democrats argue that we don’t need the SAVE Act because it’s already illegal for non-citizens to vote. Yet, they continue to ignore the evidence that non-citizens are voting.” This statement underscores the ongoing partisan divide regarding election integrity and the necessity for stricter measures to prevent illegal voting.

Urgent Call to Action

The broader context of immigration policy and voting rights amplifies the urgency for the SAVE Act. With millions of undocumented immigrants residing in the United States, ensuring that only citizens can vote has become a pressing issue. Davis articulated the stakes, saying, “With the Biden administration allowing nearly 20 million illegal immigrants into the country, the risk of compromised elections grows by the day.” He stressed that maintaining election integrity is vital for democracy, particularly as swing states become battlegrounds for both political parties.

In light of these challenges, Davis urged Americans to take action. He encouraged viewers to visit the Article III Project’s website to find resources to get involved in advocacy efforts for the SAVE Act and election integrity initiatives. “You can take action to ensure that our next election is not rigged and stolen. Every American should be concerned about this issue,” he asserted.

Illegals Could Sway the Election

As the 2024 elections approach, the conversation surrounding illegal voting and election integrity is more critical than ever. The SAVE Act represents a proactive step towards ensuring that U.S. elections are fair, transparent, and secure. By educating the public through strategic campaigns and advocating for necessary legislation, advocates like Mike Davis are fighting to protect democracy and uphold the rule of law.

For more context and to see the Article 3 project ad, watch this full segment:

Mike Davis Offers PSA To Illegal Immigrants | All Illegal Voting Will Be Prosecuted

title: Illegal Votes for Senate Could Change the USA Forever, Urgent Call for Citizen Turnout in Election
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Caroline Wren Warns: "We Lose the Senate, We Lose the Country”—Key 2024 Senate Races Crucial for Trump's Agenda As the...
content:
Caroline Wren Warns: "We Lose the Senate, We Lose the Country”—Key 2024 Senate Races Crucial for Trump’s Agenda

As the 2024 elections approach, Caroline Wren delivers a stark warning about the consequences if Republicans fail to secure both the presidency and key Senate seats. Speaking with Kash Patel on War Room, Wren emphasized that the outcome of these races could reshape the nation’s future. With polls tightening and stakes higher than ever, she urged voters to understand the gravity of the upcoming election cycle.

The 2024 Senate Battle: High Stakes for America’s Future

In the run-up to the 2024 election, Caroline Wren identified a critical issue: the survival of Donald Trump’s America First agenda hinges on winning several tight Senate races. She highlighted how closely these races are tied to Trump’s fate, pointing out, "In 68 out of 69 Senate races, Trump and the Republican Senate candidate either won or lost together.” Wren warned that if Republicans fail to secure both the presidency and Senate control, Democrats will enact sweeping changes that will permanently alter the political landscape.

Polling is Misleading—Trump’s Support is Stronger Than It Appears

Wren addressed growing concerns among conservatives over polling data showing tight races and potential losses for Trump-backed candidates. "I keep getting calls from people panicked looking at the polling,” she said. However, Wren reassured supporters that these numbers fail to capture the full picture. Many Trump supporters do not trust pollsters or the media and therefore refuse to participate in surveys. "Polling has dramatically underestimated Trump’s support,” Wren explained, underscoring that in 2016 and 2020, Trump was similarly underestimated yet pulled off victories in key swing states.

2024 Senate Races: A Must-Win for Republicans

Wren stressed the importance of key Senate races, particularly in states like Pennsylvania, Michigan, Nevada, and Arizona. "If we don’t win these swing states, we could be looking at the end of our ability to win future elections,” she cautioned. Wren pointed out that these Senate seats are not just important for control of the chamber, but for ensuring that Trump’s legislative and judicial appointments can proceed unimpeded. She emphasized, "We need 52, 53, or even 54 seats to ensure Trump’s cabinet members are confirmed and to enact his agenda.”

The Threat of a Democrat-Controlled Senate: Legalizing Millions and Reshaping the Supreme Court

The consequences of losing these Senate races, according to Wren, would be devastating for Republicans and for the future of the country. Should Democrats win, they will waste no time in enacting radical changes. Wren outlined three major threats: "They will immediately lift the filibuster, legalize 30 million illegal citizens who will become forever voters, and pack the Supreme Court.” These steps, she warned, would lead to a permanent Democrat majority and reshape the country in ways that would be impossible to reverse. "You will never recognize our country again,” Wren declared.

Wren also highlighted the threat of statehood for Washington, D.C., and Puerto Rico, which would add four permanent liberal senators. "That is game, set, match right there,” she warned. This would make it nearly impossible for Republicans to regain control of the Senate, cementing Democratic control over key institutions.

Arizona and Nevada: Critical Battlegrounds for Trump and Down-Ballot Republicans

Wren noted that Arizona and Nevada are two of the most critical battlegrounds in 2024. She was particularly optimistic about Trump’s performance in Arizona, despite polls showing some disparities. "I do think Donald Trump is performing the best in Arizona right now than any of these swing states,” she stated confidently, adding that the success of Trump-backed candidates like Kari Lake will play a crucial role in the overall outcome.

In Nevada, Wren expressed frustration with polling that shows Senate candidate Sam Brown trailing by significant margins. "That’s ridiculous,” Wren said, dismissing these numbers as inaccurate. She believes Brown is very much "in the hunt” and can win if the Trump ticket performs well statewide.

Mobilizing Voters: The Key to Victory

Caroline Wren’s message to Republicans was clear: voter mobilization is critical. She urged supporters to engage with their communities and make the stakes of the election crystal clear. "We need to get others out to the polls and convince them why they need to vote for Donald Trump and their Senate candidates,” she said. Wren stressed the importance of focusing on what happens if Republicans lose. "If we do not win these swing states, and God forbid, Donald Trump loses… you will never recognize our country again,” she warned.

Wren reminded listeners that time is running out and every vote matters. The future of the country is at stake, and this election will determine whether America continues on the path of conservative values or succumbs to a liberal agenda that could reshape the nation forever.

For more context, watch the full segment featuring Caroline Wren on Monday’s WarRoom program:

Caroline Wren Foresees Massive Senate Victories, Identifies Must-Win Races

title: Unveiling the Shadow Network: Barack H. Obama’s Lasting Impact According to Lee Smith
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Journalist Lee Smith appeared on Monday's WarRoom and highlighted the profound implications of former President Barack Obama’s administration, asserting that...
content:
Journalist Lee Smith appeared on Monday’s WarRoom and highlighted the profound implications of former President Barack Obama’s administration, asserting that it continues to shape U.S. politics today. He identifies Obama as the architect behind a shadow network influencing current political narratives and actions against Donald Trump and his supporters. Understanding these dynamics is crucial for Americans navigating the complexities of national security and political accountability.

The Legacy of Barack H. Obama

Smith’s commentary underscores the importance of examining Barack Obama’s presidency, not just as a historical footnote, but as a significant force in shaping contemporary politics. "What I’ve done is identify and amass evidence showing that the person who’s been driving this campaign… is Barack Obama,” Smith asserted. This perspective challenges the notion of a faceless "deep state,” presenting Obama as a central figure orchestrating efforts against his political opponents, particularly Donald Trump.

Obama’s Shadow Network

Smith posits that Obama’s influence extends beyond mere policy decisions; it manifests in a comprehensive "shadow network” that involves intelligence figures and legal operatives working to undermine Trump and his allies. According to Smith, this network employs tactics that manipulate public perception and maintain control over political discourse. He noted, "It’s not just a deep state; it’s not an abstraction… It’s Barack Obama at the head of what I describe as a shadow network.” This assertion calls for a critical examination of the systemic forces at play in American politics today.

Consequences of Obama’s Presidency

The ramifications of Obama’s presidency are multifaceted, impacting national security, diplomatic relations, and the integrity of democratic processes. Smith’s claims about Robert Malley, a former Iran envoy under Obama, illustrate these consequences. Malley is accused of mishandling sensitive information that could compromise national security, raising concerns about the current administration’s commitment to transparency and accountability. Smith stated, "What Mali actually did… seems that he put classified information from classified electronic devices over to personal devices.” This mishandling reflects a broader pattern of negligence that can be traced back to policies established during Obama’s tenure.

Implications for National Security

Understanding the implications of Obama’s presidency is particularly vital in the context of national security. Smith argues that the Obama administration’s approach towards Iran, characterized by the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), aimed to legitimize Iran’s nuclear ambitions rather than prevent them. He stated, "It was never designed to stop Iran from getting a bomb. The purpose was to legalize it.” This failure to effectively counter threats from Iran and its proxies has ongoing consequences for both U.S. interests and global stability.

The Fight for Political Accountability

The revelations put forth by Smith emphasize the need for political accountability and transparency in the U.S. government. As Smith prepares to release his upcoming book, Disappearing the President: Trump, the Fight for the Republic, he aims to shed light on the systematic targeting of Trump and his supporters by a network that stretches back to Obama’s presidency. "It’s amazing the way he’s strong-armed big tech into going after his political opponents,” Smith elaborated, indicating the lengths this shadow network has gone to stifle dissent.

Moving Forward: Understanding the Legacy

As America approaches critical elections, understanding the consequences of Obama’s presidency becomes increasingly essential. Past actions and policies shape the dynamics of power, influence, and accountability in politics, making it vital for citizens to engage with this history. Smith’s insights remind us that the impact of Obama’s presidency is not confined to the past; it continues to influence the present political landscape.

Lee Smith’s analysis of Barack H. Obama’s enduring impact reveals a complex interplay of power and influence that shapes contemporary American politics. By identifying Obama as the leader of a shadow network that undermines political accountability, Smith calls attention to scrutinizing past administrations to understand current challenges. As the nation navigates these turbulent waters, the legacy of Obama remains a critical factor in shaping America’s political future. Understanding this legacy empowers citizens to advocate for transparency and integrity in their government, ensuring that the lessons of the past are not forgotten.

title: Christians in Crisis: The Urgent Call to Action Amidst Moral Decay from Steve Bannon’s WarRoom
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Stop 'Wokeism' with Faith Despite 80% of Americans identifying as Christians, a shocking disconnect exists between faith and civic engagement,...
content:
Stop ‘Wokeism’ with Faith

Despite 80% of Americans identifying as Christians, a shocking disconnect exists between faith and civic engagement, as evidenced by alarming trends in voter turnout and moral beliefs. David Barton and Bill Federer appeared on the WarRoom on Thursday to urge church leaders and congregants to rise against the tide of secularism and reclaim the nation through informed voting and active participation in societal issues.

A Disturbing Disconnect Between Faith and Action

In a recent panel discussion, David Barton, Bill Federer, and Dave Brat confronted the stark reality facing American Christians today. Barton highlighted a significant paradox: "You have 80% of the United States identifying as Christians, and yet we have a woke weaponized $7 trillion budget and a border invasion. The nation is under attack.” This alarming situation begs the question: why are Christians not translating their faith into action?

Barton pointed to the troubling trends revealed in two national polls, which indicated a steep decline in the voting engagement of professing Christians. Historically, this demographic has been one of the most reliable voting blocs, with 99% turnout in 2016. Yet, the current projected turnout for active church-going Christians sits at a staggering 41% who are not planning to vote in the upcoming elections. "That’s only 59% that will vote, and this is a constituency where Trump held a much higher number in previous elections,” Barton noted, expressing his concern over this disengagement.

The Crisis of Moral Clarity

The panelists also discussed the alarming shift in the moral landscape among church-going Christians. Barton revealed, "56% of church-going Christians say there are no absolute rights and wrongs. No moral truths.” This shift raises critical questions about the foundational beliefs that underpin Christianity. Incredibly, 42% of these Christians support abortion under all circumstances, and 30% favor socialism over capitalism—positions that starkly contrast with traditional Christian doctrine.

"It’s a very disturbing picture,” Barton stated, emphasizing the need for a revival of moral clarity among believers. This crisis of values can no longer be ignored, especially when many Christians are basing their voting decisions on factors that have little to do with their faith.

The Role of Pastors in Mobilization

One significant aspect of this discussion was the call to action directed at pastors and church leaders. Both Barton and Federer emphasized the vital role that church leaders must play in encouraging their congregations to engage in the political process. "19% of these folks say they’re more likely to vote if they hear something from the pulpit,” said Barton. "If pastors would talk about these issues and encourage their congregations to vote, we could see a dramatic increase in voter turnout.”

However, the statistics are sobering; only 2.8% of pastors address the pressing societal issues currently affecting the nation from the pulpit. This silence contributes to a culture of apathy and disengagement among Christians, allowing moral decay to flourish unchecked.

Accountability to God

The conversation took a poignant turn as Barton reminded listeners of their accountability to God. "Someday, you will stand before Him and be asked, ‘What did you do with the country I gave you?’” he warned. "Saying ‘I didn’t like any of the candidates’ is not going to be a good answer.” This powerful reminder serves as a rallying cry for Christians to take their civic responsibilities seriously and act in alignment with their beliefs.

A Call for Awakening

As the discussion concluded, it was evident that the stakes have never been higher for American Christians. The combined effects of political apathy and moral confusion present a formidable challenge to the future of the nation. Yet, as Barton and Federer emphasized, there is still hope. "If we give them the right call, we can get a response,” Barton asserted, encouraging believers to step forward and reclaim their voice in the public square.

In a time when faith and action seem worlds apart, the clarion call is clear: Christians must awaken from their slumber, engage in the political process, and re-establish the moral foundations upon which this nation was built. The future of America may very well depend on it.

To hear more, watch these Thursday WarRoom segments:

David Barton Calls Out Pastors And Priests To GOTV This November, Securing Our Christian Values

William Federer: Christians Should Display Their Beliefs Through Their Vote

title: Resisting Defeatism: Richard Barris Exposes Hidden Polls and Warns Against Media’s Black Pilling Tactics in Election
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Richard Barris Critiques Defeatism in Political Polling "With all these stories of cheating, people are saying they won't vote because...
content:
Richard Barris Critiques Defeatism in Political Polling

“With all these stories of cheating, people are saying they won’t vote because their votes doesn’t count.  That is wrong. Your vote does count,” Barris told Peter Navarro.

Richard Barris appeared on Monday’s WarRoom and challenged the narrative of defeatism in political polling, particularly regarding Kamala Harris and her perceived underdog status. He argues that the media’s portrayal of Harris as a frontrunner is misleading and undermines genuine voter sentiment. Barris asserts that many Americans recognize the reality of the political landscape and are beginning to lean toward Donald Trump despite previous hesitations.

Media Influence and Polling Perception

Richard Barris highlights the media’s significant role in shaping public perception of political candidates. He argues that the current media landscape is heavily biased in favor of Harris, stating, "The entire world is against Donald Trump.” This statement underscores his belief that major media outlets, from Fox News to MSNBC, are actively promoting Harris while undermining Trump. He further elaborates, "Everyone… wants Harris to win,” suggesting a concerted effort to create a narrative that does not align with voter sentiment.

Misleading Polls and Public Sentiment

Barris emphasizes the disconnect between public polls and the true feelings of the electorate. He notes, "Kamala Harris’s polling does not look rosy for her,” pointing out that the reported numbers do not accurately reflect the mood among voters. Barris argues that many polls lack consensus, misleadingly portraying Harris’s viability as a candidate. He criticizes the notion that Harris can maintain a solid lead against Trump, calling it "insane” to believe she could outperform Barack Obama in critical states like Pennsylvania.

The Reality of Trump’s Support

Barris identifies a growing trend among previously reluctant Trump supporters now leaning toward him. He notes, "There is a fear… among those reluctant Trump supporters,” indicating that their concerns about Harris’s perceived radicalism outweigh their previous apprehensions about Trump’s chaotic style. He refers to these voters as "seasick voters,” who appreciate Trump’s policies but were initially put off by his demeanor. However, they now recognize Trump’s capabilities, acknowledging, "They know Trump can do the job,” reinforcing that his track record is beginning to resonate with them.

Concerns About Cheating and Defeatism

Barris also addresses the issue of electoral integrity, emphasizing that discussions around cheating can foster a sense of defeatism among voters. He argues that when people become overly fixated on allegations of electoral manipulation, it undermines their belief in the democratic process. "When we talk about cheating, it can lead to hopelessness,” he states, underscoring that this mindset can deter people from voting. Instead of succumbing to this narrative, Barris advocates for proactive engagement, encouraging supporters to maintain faith in the electoral system and to participate actively.

Harris’s Missed Opportunities

Barris criticizes Harris for failing to effectively communicate her message during debates, stating that she did not spend enough time convincing undecided voters to support her. He asserts, "They want to know what she is saying that can allow me to put my fate in her hands.” This reflects a broader issue of trust and connection that Harris has yet to establish with potential supporters. Instead of addressing her qualifications and vision, she often resorts to attacking Trump, which Barris argues is counterproductive.

The Presidential Bar and Voter Confidence

A key point Barris makes is that Harris has not met the "presidential bar” required to gain voter confidence. He articulates, "People are still wondering… if she can do this job.” This lack of assurance is a significant hurdle for her campaign. Barris’s assertion that Harris’s recent surge in popularity is a "media fabrication” further emphasizes his view that the narrative surrounding her is not rooted in reality but rather in favorable coverage and party support.

A Call for Realism

Barris’s comments reveal a critical perspective on the current political climate. He challenges the defeatism in polling narratives, emphasizing the need for a realistic understanding of voter sentiment. By highlighting the media’s influence, the disconnect between polling data and public opinion, and Harris’s failure to engage with undecided voters, Barris paints a picture of a political landscape where many are beginning to favor Trump. As he states, "Winners don’t ask for more debates,” suggesting that true confidence comes from a position of strength rather than from seeking validation through repeated contests.

Ultimately, Barris’s message is clear: maintaining engagement, fostering trust in the electoral process, and recognizing the realities of voter sentiment are crucial for success in the current political landscape.

For more context, watch Richard Barris on Monday’s WarRoom:

Baris Explains The Lack Of Trust The American People Have In Kamala

title: We Need Steve Bannon and His Crucial Breakdowns: DC’s Looming Shutdown, the SAVE Act Standoff, and a Nation in Crisis
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Time is Running Out: Why American Voters Need Steve Bannon Now More Than Ever The American public is clamoring for...
content:
Time is Running Out: Why American Voters Need Steve Bannon Now More Than Ever

The American public is clamoring for clarity as the nation stands on the edge of a potential government shutdown, with less than 50 days until the critical November 5 election. Steve Bannon, a leading populist voice, is uniquely positioned to provide that insight. However, he is serving the final month of his sentence in a federal correctional facility for defying a Congressional subpoena; Bannon remains one of the few figures capable of cutting through the political noise.

With the SAVE Act gridlocked in the Senate and a government funding crisis looming on September 30, the stakes couldn’t be higher. In this pivotal moment, Bannon’s insights on Washington’s dysfunctional inner workings are essential to understanding the larger battle that is unfolding.

McConnell’s Focus on Tax Hikes and Military Spending, Ignoring National Security Threats

In an exclusive report by The Daily Signal, the troubling disconnect between Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell’s priorities and the nation’s urgent issues was laid bare. While House Republicans scramble to pass a continuing resolution to avoid a shutdown and push forward the SAVE Act, McConnell instead spent the Senate GOP’s weekly luncheon discussing tax hikes to boost Pentagon funding.

At a time when two assassination attempts on former President Donald Trump have shaken the political landscape, McConnell’s tone-deaf response has angered many within his party. Rather than addressing these pressing threats, McConnell chose to focus on raising taxes, a move that runs counter to the Republican platform and Trump’s economic policies.

The luncheon discussion revolved around a recent report by the Commission on the National Defense Strategy, which suggested that defense spending increases should be tied to tax hikes. McConnell echoed these sentiments, citing historical tax rates from the Cold War era to justify his position. However, critics argue that increased taxes in today’s political climate would only serve to widen the gap between Washington elites and the American working class.

This stark contrast between the House’s focus on addressing critical issues and McConnell’s apparent detachment highlights the political dysfunction that voters are desperate to understand.

Steve Bannon’s 2023 Warning: A Fight Over Washington’s Outsiders and Donor-Class Elites

In a 2023 segment of WarRoom, Steve Bannon’s sharp commentary on the political elite’s hatred for Donald Trump offers a chilling reflection of the current crisis. Bannon explained that Trump’s status as an outsider, and his refusal to be controlled by the donor class, is what made him a target.

"The reason they hate Trump… is that he puts you in the room, at the head of the table. The donor class can’t and will never forgive him for that,” Bannon remarked, in a reaccuring theme for Bannon describing the Power of the MAGA movement.

In 2016, with help from Bannon,  Trump upended the political order by refusing to rely on big donors. This independence, Bannon argues, gave power back to the people, creating a populist-nationalist movement that the elites couldn’t control.

Bannon’s analysis goes deeper, touching on the broader financial manipulation in Washington DC. He highlighted the stark contrast between the everyday Americans affected by inflation, high mortgage rates, and economic instability and the elites who manipulate the system to their advantage. This systemic exploitation, Bannon asserts, is why figures like Trump and the populist movement are seen as such a threat.

The Intersection of Money, Power, and Washington’s Broken System

In his WarRoom commentary, Bannon dissected the "politics of money,” pointing out that the current economic crises are not inevitable. "These are not immutable laws of physics,” Bannon noted. "This is all through human agency in decisions.” He explained that the economic challenges the country faces—inflation, mortgage prices, or reckless spending—result from intentional policies crafted by the elite donor class to protect their interests.

Bannon’s commentary illuminates the growing frustration among voters who feel shut out of the decision-making process in Washington. He points to the historical concentration of financial power in the hands of a few, tracing it back to the establishment of the Federal Reserve and the introduction of income taxes. Bannon argues that this manipulation of economic systems is at the root of America’s current political and financial crises.

America’s Moment of Reckoning: Why Steve Bannon’s Voice Matters Now

As Bannon nears the end of his sentence at the end of October, his perspective on the looming government shutdown and the SAVE Act’s uncertain fate in the Senate is more critical than ever. He understands the stakes of this battle—both for the American people and for the future of the populist movement. His warning in 2023 about the elite donor class’s manipulation of Washington’s economic systems rings truer than ever as the nation teeters on the edge of another shutdown.

The establishment’s failure to address these pressing issues and the donor class’s grip on economic policies are precisely why Bannon’s voice is essential in this moment. The WarRoom is a platform where the political and economic interests that drive Washington can be exposed and dissected. As Americans face a crisis of trust in their leadership, Steve Bannon’s unfiltered analysis is precisely what the country needs to understand the larger forces at play.

Steve Bannon’s Return to the WarRoom is Critical for American Voters

With a government shutdown looming, a critical election just weeks away, and the SAVE Act stuck in legislative limbo, Steve Bannon’s return to the political stage is pivotal. His insights into Washington’s broken system, the influence of the donor class, and the elite’s disregard for the working class are crucial for voters seeking clarity. As he completes his sentence and resumes his WarRoom platform, Bannon’s analysis will be key to navigating the political and economic storms ahead.
